header.title: Third Party Extensions

abstract.p: This document lists third-party metadata extensions that are known to be compatible with the OLAC Metadata standards. They have not attained the status of OLAC Recommendations, but data providers are encouraged to try any that seem relevant to the nature of their collection.

section.heading: Introduction
section.p: The OLAC Metadata standard OLAC-Metadata follows the generic resource description standard known as "Qualified Dublin Core" DCQ, and supports a powerful extension mechanism described in OLAC-Extensions. Any party may develop their own metadata extension and use it in OLAC metadata records. This document lists the third-party extensions which are known to work with OLAC Metadata. Each extension is described in terms of a title and the following five attributes:

dd.p: The symbolic name that is used as the value of the xsi:type attribute to indicate that the extension is being used in a metadata element.
The latest revision date of the extension or its controlled vocabulary.
The Dublin Core elements with which the extension may be used.
A summary description of what the extension is used for.
A link to a complete document that defines and exemplifies the extension. If the extension involves a controlled vocabulary, the document should also enumerate and define the terms of the vocabulary.

section.heading: Third party extensions
section.p: There are currently no third-party extensions.
